title: How to find Low Competition High Volume Keywords - Low Content Book Research for Amazon KDP

tactics.name: keyword_niche_down
tactics.description: Refine broad keywords by adding demographic or use-case modifiers to reduce competition
steps: Use Amazon search suggestions to identify keyword variations
Test modified keywords like 'bill organizer for women'
Resize templates for different product sizes (e.g., purse-friendly)
caveats: May require additional design work for resized templates
source_quotes: we can niche down so now we've got bill organizer let's do bill organizer for women

tactics.name: template_resizing
tactics.description: Create multiple product versions from a single design template
steps: Resize Canva templates using Pro tools or manual resizing
Create variations for different sizes (e.g., 6x9, pocket-sized)
caveats: Requires design skills to maintain quality across sizes
source_quotes: you can resize it to maybe six by nine
you can superimpose it on your size and that's another way to do it

tactics.name: Keyword Niche Filtering
tactics.description: Identify specific keywords by filtering out irrelevant results from Amazon's search data.
steps: Check Amazon search results for keyword variations (e.g., 'bill organizer for women').
Filter out non-relevant titles (e.g., budget planners vs. bill organizers).
Use tools like Publisher Rocket to validate search volume and competition.
caveats: Amazon's search data includes irrelevant results, so manual filtering is required.
source_quotes: 'a lot of these are not bill organizers'

tactics.name: niching_down_with_keywords
tactics.description: Identify low competition niches by combining keywords and modifying templates
caveats: Not all viewers will act on the video
source_quotes: we've discovered a really niche here by using this keyword busy busy family bill organizer

heuristics.name: review_density_check
heuristics.condition: If median reviews per product are below 200, prioritize this niche
source_quotes: we can have a look and see what kind of books they are this one is quite pretty

heuristics.name: Low Review Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize the keyword.
source_quotes: 'there's not many bill organizers on amazon'

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with low competition
source_quotes: there's not many competitors and we know there's a decent amount of searches per month

claims.statement: Niche keywords with 3,000+ search results can still have high demand
source_quotes: now we've got over 3 000 results so we can have a look

claims.statement: Amazon search results include non-book formats like ring binders
source_quotes: these are not the kind of books that we produce

claims.statement: Amazon does not provide direct search volume data for keywords.
Third-party tools like Publisher Rocket estimate Amazon search volume using Google data.
source_quotes: 'tools that apparently tell you like publisher rocket'

claims.statement: Amazon KDP allows niche products with low competition to succeed
source_quotes: there aren't that many bill organizers on amazon

niche_patterns.description: Combine functional keywords with demographic modifiers and specific use cases to create targeted niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Reduces competition while maintaining search volume

niche_patterns.example: busy family + bill organization + low competition
niche_patterns.description: Target underserved sub-niches by combining specific identities with unique problems.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages low review counts and BSR gaps to identify market opportunities.
source_quotes: 'there is a gap in the market'
